author: Lesley Waters
method: Mix together all of the ingredients for the crabcakes, except the oil. Heat the oil in a frying pan. Mould the crabcakes into flat rounds and fry on both sides for 2-3 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through. Remove from the pan and drain on kitchen towel. For the salad, heat the oil and sauté the spring onion and romero pepper for 3-4 minutes. To make the dressing, mix together all the ingredients thoroughly. To serve, toss the romero pepper and spring onions with the flatleaf parsley and dressing. Place on a dish and pile the crabcakes on top.
ingredients: 4 tbsp fresh breadcrumbs,  1 tbsp cornflour,  3 tbsp cooked crab meat, white and brown, removed from shell,  1 egg, beaten,  2 tbsp olive oil,  ½ romero pepper, de-seeded, thinly sliced,  3 spring onions, thinly sliced,  2 tsp olive oil,  handful flatleaf parsley, to serve,  1 spring onion, chopped,  2 tsp soy sauce,  1 tsp sesame oil,  1 tbsp fresh coriander leaves, chopped,  squeeze of lime juice
